fields.headline: Smoke screen
fields.bodyText: Mary Kenny's defence of "socialist" smoking (Comment, September 24) echoes John Reid's plaint that a gasper was all the pleasure workers could expect. But why stop at smokes? There must be a couple of wheezing miners and shipyard workers who'll effuse on the guilty joys of black lung and asbestosis. Gavin Greenwood Brighton Is it really necessary for the Chapman brothers to recreate their version of hell (Report, September 23)? Isn't hell unfolding in front of our eyes, in Iraq, in Darfur, in Gaza, in North Ossetia? Harry Eyres London Among the discussions as to what the Lib Dems stand for (Letters, September 24), I am reminded of two views of what constitutes a liberal: the English socialist's definition of "a Tory with a conscience", or the American right's dismissal as "a socialist with a mortgage and two children". Richard Bewley Glossop, Derbyshire Robert Boon's (Letters, September 24) suggestion of a possible Tory policy limiting the number of patients allowed treatment in casualty departments was irresponsible as it will probably now appear in their manifesto. David Prothero Harpenden, Herts Donald Rumsfeld argues that if certain areas of Iraq cannot provide a secure location for democratic expression, they should not be included in the January election (Report, September 24). I wonder how many wish that a similar principle had been applied to Florida in 2000? Tristan Clayton Epsom, Surrey Is sending plastic to China like sending coals to Newcastle, only greener (Letters, September 22)? Chris Paul Manchester
